page.title: 15POLICE STATION/COURT BROUGH
page.content: There has been a police station and court in Brough since 1900. It was closed down for a short time, but re_opened in 1973 in its present form. The Court sits for two sessions on Mondays for traffic offences, Wednesdays for crimes,_ and Fridays for juvenile and domestic cases, dealing with approximately 8,000 cases annually. Serious crimes are referred to the Crown Courts at Beverley or York, and convicted offenders with jail sentences are sent to Leeds Gaol for men, or Durham Gaol for women.Once a motorist was fined for a traffic offence which he could not afford to pay. He brought a calf, complete with water and feed, to the Court in lieu of payment. Fortunately, from the resulting publicity,, the fine was paid in cash by a well_wisher.
